remarks: Write a double sum as a sum over a two-dimensional region.  Note that ` B ( j ) ` is a function of ` j ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2014.)
statement:
fsum2d.1 $e |- ( z = <. j , k >. -> D = C ) $.
fsum2d.2 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fsum2d.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ j e. A ) -> B e. Fin ) $.
fsum2d.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( j e. A /\ k e. B ) ) -> C e. CC ) $.
fsum2d $p |- ( ph -> sum_ j e. A sum_ k e. B C = sum_ z e. U_ j e. A ( { j } X. B ) D ) $.
$d A j k z $.
$d B k z $.
$d C z $.
$d D j k $.
$d j k ph z $.
